parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Strengthened for a primary edo; used only in certain tenses, the rest being supplied by phago; to eat.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To sell, exchange, barter. Probably ultimately from pelomai; to barter, i.e. To sell.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A meat-market, marketplace. Of Latin origin; a butcher's stall, meat market or provision-shop.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From ana and krino; properly, to scrutinize, i.e. investigate, interrogate, determine.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The conscience, a persisting notion. From a prolonged form of suneido; co-perception, i.e. Moral consciousness.
